IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: ViviGen Cellular Bone Matrix for Hindfoot or Ankle Arthrodesis
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Clinical and Radiographic Outcomes Using ViviGenÂ® Cellular Bone Matrix for Complex Hindfoot Arthrodesis

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: To evaluate the fusion status of the hindfoot bones after receiving the ViviGen graft, an FDA approved cellular bone matrix. This is used in a population indicated for hindfoot arthrodesis as an alternative to an autograft.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: Patients will receive the vivigen cellular bone matrix

Intervention.InterventionDescription: A cellular bone matrix which includes viable osteoblasts within a corticocancellous and demineralized bone carrier, represents a unique alternative to autograft or existing products which utilize mesenchymal stem cells.

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Radiographic evidence of successful arthrodesis confirmed on Computed Tomography (CT) scan defined by >50%

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Failure of hardware or obvious non-union
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Failure measured through clinical and radiographic evidence

Patient reported outcome measurement that includes 29-item questionnaire divided into two subscales: 21-item activities of daily living subscale and 8-item sports subscale. Response options are given in 5 point Likert scales (range from 4-0)

Patient Foot pain reported on a 10 Centimeter line. Patient is asked to draw a vertical line where they believe their pain falls at rest and when active. This is on a scale of 0-10 with 0 being no pain and 10 being the most pain.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: American Orthopaedic Foot and Ankle Society(AOFAS) hindfoot score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Patient reported outcome for a standardized evaluation of clinical status of ankle- hindfoot. Patient reports their pain and the physician records physical assessment of alignment. Finally function is reported and the AOFAS score ranged from 0-100 with 100 being healthy ankles.
Patient reported outcome for health related quality of life using a 12 item questionnaire. This is broken into two scores: Physical Health component scores, and Mental Health component scores.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System Physical Function-Short Form 8b (PROMIS Item Bank v2.0-Physical Function -Short Form 8b)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Patient self-reported capability for physical function using 8 questions to assess current function of an adult in the general population.

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patient with prescribed standard of care unilateral hindfoot ankle arthrodesis procedure
Age 18-80
Willing to complete all follow up evaluations

Exclusion Criteria:

Prior infection at site of planned arthrodesis
Prior arthrodesis procedure
Inability to maintain non-weight bearing status
Bone defect requiring more than 10 cc of bone graft material
Known Vitamin D deficiency with a Vitamin D level of <30ng/ml 1 week prior to surgery
Inadequate bone stock to allow for rigid internal fixation
Hemoglobin A1C greater than 8.0%
Tobacco or Nicotine use 6 weeks prior to surgery
BMI greater than 40

ConditionBrowseBranch.ConditionBrowseBranchName: Diseases and Abnormalities at or Before Birth
